Methods¶

Lik.__init__(name=None, logpdf=None, logpdf_args=None, logpdf_kwargs=None, pars_central=None, pars_pos_poi=None, pars_pos_nuis=None, pars_labels=None, pars_bounds=None, output_folder=None, input_file=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

The Lik object can be initialized in two different ways, depending on the value of the input_file argument.

  • input_file is None (default)

    All other arguments are parsed and saved in corresponding attributes. If no name is given, then one is created. The object is saved upon creation through the Lik.save method.

  • input_file is not None

    The object is reconstructed from the input files through the private method Lik.__load Depending on the value of the input argument output_folder the Lik.__init__ method behaves as follows:

    • If output_folder is None (default)

      The attribute Lik.output_folder is set from the Lik.input_folder one.

    • If output_folder corresponds to a path different from that stored in the loaded Lik.output_folder attribute

      • if path stored in the loaded Lik.output_folder attribute exists, then its content is copied to the new output_folder (if the new output_foler already exists it is renamed by adding a timestamp);

      • if path stored in the loaded Lik.output_folder does not exists, then the content of the path Lik.input_folder is copied to the new output_folder.

    • If output_folder corresponds to the same path stored in the loaded Lik.output_folder attribute

      Output folder, files, and path attributes are not updated and everything is read from the loaded object.

  • Arguments

    See class Arguments documentation.

  • Creates/updates files

    • Lik.output_h5_file (only the first time the object is created, i.e. if input_file is None)

    • Lik.output_log_file

Lik._Lik__check_define_input_files(verbose=False)¶

Private method used by the Lik.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to input files

  • Lik.input_h5_file,

  • Lik.input_log_file,

  • Lik.input_folder

depending on the value of the Lik.input_file attribute.

Lik._Lik__check_define_output_files(output_folder=None, timestamp=None, verbose=False)¶

Private method used by the Lik.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to output folders

  • Lik.output_figures_folder

  • Lik.output_folder

and output files

  • Lik.output_figures_base_file

  • Lik.output_h5_file

  • Lik.output_log_file

  • Lik.output_predictions_json_file

  • Lik.script_file

depending on the value of the Lik.output_folder attribute. It also creates the folders Lik.output_folder and Lik.output_figures_folder if they do not exist.

Lik._Lik__check_define_name()¶

Private method used by the Lik.__init__ one to define the Lik.name attribute. If it is None it replaces it with "model_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]+"_likelihood", otherwise it appends the suffix “_likelihood” (preventing duplication if it is already present).

Lik._Lik__check_define_ndims()¶

Private method used by the Lik.__check_define_pars one to define the Lik.ndims attribute. To determine the number of dimensions it computes the logpdf, by calling the Lik.logpdf passing it a vector of growing size until it does not generate an error.

Lik._Lik__check_define_pars(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the Lik.__init__ one to check the consistency and set the attributes

  • Lik.ndims

  • Lik.pars_bounds (converted into numpy.ndarray)

  • Lik.pars_central (converted into numpy.ndarray)

  • Lik.pars_labels

  • Lik.pars_labels_auto

  • Lik.pars_pos_nuis (converted into numpy.ndarray)

  • Lik.pars_pos_poi (converted into numpy.ndarray)

If the attribute Lik.pars_central is None, the method calls the Lik.__check_define_ndims method to determine the number of dimensions Lik.ndims and sets Lik.pars_central to a vector of zeros with length Lik.ndims, warning the user that dimensiona and parameters central values have been automatically determined. If no parameters positions are specified, all parameters are assumed to be parameters of interest. If only the position of the parameters of interest or of the nuisance parameters is specified, the other is automatically generated by matching dimensions. If labels are not provided then Lik.pars_labels is set to the value of Lik.pars_labels_auto. If parameters bounds are not provided, they are set to (-np.inf,np.inf). A check is performed on the length of the four attributes and an Exception is raised if the length does not match Lik.ndims.

Lik._Lik__load(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the Lik.__init__ one to load a previously saved Lik object from the files

  • Lik.input_h5_file

  • Lik.input_log_file

The method loads, with the deepdish package, the content od the Lik.input_h5_file file into a temporary dictionary, subsequently used to update the Lik.__dict__ attribute. The "logpdf_dump" item of the loaded dictionary is a numpy.void object containing the a dump of the callable Lik.logpdf attribute produced by the cloudpickle package (see the documentation of the Lik.save method). This item is first converted into a (binary) string, then loaded with cloudpickle to reconstruct the Lik.logpdf attribute. The method also loads the content of the Lik.input_log_file file, assigning it to the Lik.log attribute.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Lik._Lik__set_pars_labels(pars_labels)¶

Private method that returns the pars_labels choice based on the pars_labels input.

  • Arguments

    • pars_labels

      Could be either one of the keyword strings "original" and "autp" or a list of labels strings with the length of the parameters array. If pars_labels="original" or pars_labels="auto" the function returns the value of Lik.pars_labels or Lik.pars_labels_auto, respectively, while if pars_labels is a list, the function just returns the input.

      • type: list or str

      • shape of list: [ ]

      • accepted strings: "original", "auto"

Lik.save_log(timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Saves the content of the Lik.log attribute in the file Lik.output_log_file.

This method is called by the methods

  • Lik.__init__ with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub if Lik.input_file is not None, and with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub otherwise.

  • Lik.compute_maximum_logpdf with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Lik.compute_profiled_maxima_logpdf with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Lik.plot_logpdf_par with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Lik.plot_tmu_1d with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Lik.save with overwrite=overwrite and verbose=verbose

  • Lik.save_script with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Arguments

    • timestamp

      A timestamp string with format "datetime_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S_%fZ")[:-3]. If it is not passed, then it is generated. It is passed to the utils.generate_dump_file_name function to generate the dump file name.

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function. If "dump", a dump of the file is saved through the utils.generate_dump_file_name function.

      • type: bool or str

      • allowed str: "dump"

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates file

    • Lik.output_log_file

Lik.save(timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

The Lik object is saved to the HDF5 file Lik.output_h5_file and the object log is saved to the json file Lik.output_log_file. The object is saved by storing the content of the :attr:Lik.__dict__ <DNNLikelihood.Lik.__dict__> attribute in an h5 file using the deepdish package. In order to be able to store the callable Lik.logpdf attribute, this is first serialized to a byte string using the cloudpickle package, and then encoded into a numpy.void object. This is stored in a dedicated "logpdf_dump" key of the object dictionary and is used to restore the Lik.logpdf attribute when the object is loaded (see the documentation of the Lik.__load method). The following attributes are excluded from the saved dictionary:

  • Lik.input_file

  • Lik.input_h5_file

  • Lik.input_log_file

  • Lik.input_folder

  • Lik.log (saved to the file Lik.output_log_file)

  • Lik.verbose

  • Arguments

    • timestamp

      A timestamp string with format "datetime_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S_%fZ")[:-3]. If it is not passed, then it is generated. It is used to update the Lik.log object and, when overwrite="dump", is passed to the utils.generate_dump_file_name function to generate the dump file name.

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function. If "dump", a dump of the file is saved through the utils.generate_dump_file_name function.

      • type: bool or str

      • allowed str: "dump"

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates files

    • Lik.output_h5_file

    • Lik.output_log_file

Lik.save_script(timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=True)[source]¶

Saves the file Lik.script_file.

  • Arguments

    • timestamp

      A timestamp string with format "datetime_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S_%fZ")[:-3]. If it is not passed, then it is generated. It is used to update the Lik.log object and, when overwrite="dump", is passed to the utils.generate_dump_file_name function to generate the dump file name.

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function. If "dump", a dump of the file is saved through the utils.generate_dump_file_name function.

      • type: bool or str

      • allowed str: "dump"

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates file

    • Lik.script_file

Lik.logpdf_fn(x_pars, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This function is used to add constraints and standardize input/output of Lik.logpdf. It is constructed from the Lik.logpdf and Lik.logpdf_args attributes. In the case Lik.logpdf accepts a single array of parameters x_pars and returns the logpdf value one point at a time, then the function returns a float, while if Lik.logpdf is vectorized, i.e. accepts an array of x_pars arrays and returns an array of logpdf values, then the function returns an array. Moreover, the Lik.logpdf_fn method is constructed to return the logpdf value -np.inf if any of the parameters lies outside Lik.pars_bounds or the Lik.logpdf function returns nan.

  • Arguments

    • x_pars

      Values of the parameters for which logpdf is computed. It could be a single point in parameter space corresponding to an array with shape (n_pars,)) or a list of points corresponding to an array with shape (n_points,n_pars), depending on the equivalent argument accepted by Lik.logpdf.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (n_pars,) or (n_points,n_pars)

    • args

      Optional list of additional positional arguments needed by the Lik.logpdf function.

      • type: list or None

      • shape of list: []

    • kwargs

      Optional dictionary of additionale keyword arguments needed by the Lik.logpdf function.

      • type: dict or None

  • Returns

    Value (values) of the logpdf.

    • type: float or numpy.ndarray

    • shape for numpy.ndarray: (n_points,)

Lik.reset_predictions(delete_figures=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Re-initializes the Lik.predictions dictionary to

predictions = {"logpdf_max": {},
               "logpdf_profiled_max": {},
               "Figures": figs}

Where figs may be either an empty dictionary or the present value of the corresponding one, depending on the value of the delete_figures argument.

  • Arguments

    • delete_figures

      If True all files in the Lik.output_figures_folder folder are deleted and the "Figures" item is reset to an empty dictionary.

      • type: bool

      • default: True

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Lik.compute_maximum_logpdf(pars_init=None, optimizer={}, timestamp=None, save=False, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Computes the maximum of Lik.logpdf_fn. All information on the maximum, including parameters initialization, parameters bounds, and optimizer, are stored in the "logpdf_max" item of the Lik.predictions dictionary. The method uses the function inference.compute_maximum_logpdf based on scipy.optimize.minimize to find the minimum of minus Lik.logpdf_fn. Since the latter method already contains a bounded logpdf, pars_bounds is set to None in the inference.compute_maximum_logpdf function to optimize speed. See the documentation of the inference.compute_maximum_logpdf function for details.

  • Arguments

    • pars_init

      Starting point for the optimization. If it is None, then it is set to the parameters central value Lik.pars_central.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (ndim,)

      • default: None (automatically modified to Lik.pars_central)

    • optimizer

      Dictionary containing information on the optimizer and its options.

      • type: dict with the following structure:

        • “name” (value type: str) This is always set to "scipy", which is by now the only available optimizer for this task. As more optimizers will be supported the "name" key will indicate the chosen one.

        • “method” (value type: str) Optimizer method. For the scipy.optimize.minimize optimizer the default method is given by "Powell".

        • “options” (value type: dict) Dictionary containing additional options to pass to the scipy.optimize.minimize function.

      • default: {}

      • schematic example:

        optimizer={"name": "scipy",
           "method": "Powell",
           "options": {"maxiter": 10000,
                       "ftol": 0.001}}

    • timestamp

      A timestamp string with format "datetime_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S_%fZ")[:-3]. If it is not passed, then it is generated. It is used as key in the Lik.predictions["logpdf_max"] dictionary to save the current prediction. It is also used to update the Lik.log dictionary and to save the object when overwrite="dump".

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • save

      If True the object is saved (by passing the overwrite argument to the Lik.save method).

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function. If "dump", a dump of the file is saved through the utils.generate_dump_file_name function.

      • type: bool or str

      • allowed str: "dump"

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates files

    • Lik.output_h5_file (only if save=True)

    • Lik.output_log_file (always)

Lik.compute_profiled_maxima_logpdf(pars=None, pars_ranges=None, pars_init=None, pars_bounds=None, spacing='grid', optimizer={}, timestamp=None, progressbar=False, save=False, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Computes logal maxima of the logpdf for different values of the parameter pars. For the list of prameters pars, ranges are passed as pars_ranges in the form (par_min,par_max,n_points) and an array of points is generated according to the argument spacing (either a grid or a random flat distribution) in the interval. The points in the grid falling outside Lik.pars_bounds are automatically removed. All information on the maximum, including parameters initialization, parameters bounds, and optimizer, are stored in the "logpdf_profiled_max" item of the Lik.predictions dictionary. The method also automatically computes, with the same optimizer, the absolute maximum and the \(t_{\pmb\mu}\) test statistics. The latter is defined, given a vector of parameters of interest \(\pmb\mu\) and a vector of nuisance parameters \(\pmb\delta\) as

\[t_{\pmb\mu}=-2\left(\sup_{\pmb\delta}\log\mathcal{L}(\pmb\mu,\pmb\delta)-\sup_{\pmb\mu,\pmb\delta}\log\mathcal{L}(\pmb\mu,\pmb\delta)\right).\]

Profiled maxima could be used both for frequentist inference and as initial condition for Markov Chain Monte Carlo through the Sampler object (see the Sampler object documentation). The method uses the function inference.compute_profiled_maximum_logpdf based on scipy.optimize.minimize to find the (local) minimum of minus Lik.logpdf_fn. Since the latter method already contains a bounded logpdf, pars_bounds is set to None in the inference.compute_profiled_maximum_logpdf function to optimize speed. See the documentation of the inference.compute_profiled_maximum_logpdf function for details.

When using interactive python in Jupyter notebooks if progressbar=True then a progress bar is shown through the ipywidgets package.

  • Arguments

    • pars

      List of positions of the parameters under which logpdf is not profiled.

      • type: list

      • shape: [ ]

      • example: [1,5,8]

    • pars_ranges

      Ranges of the parameters pars containing (min,max,n_points).

      • type: list

      • shape: [[ ]]

      • example: [[0,1,5],[-1,1,5],[0,5,3]]

    • pars_init

      Starting point for the optimization. If it is None, then it is set to the parameters central value Lik.pars_central.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (ndim,)

      • default: None (automatically modified to Lik.pars_central)

    • pars_bounds

      Bounds on the parameters. If it is None, then it is set to the parameters bounds attribute Lik.pars_bounds.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (ndim,2)

      • default: None (automatically modified to Lik.pars_bounds)

    • spacing

      It can be either "grid" or "random". Depending on its value the n_points for each parameter are taken on an equally spaced grid or are generated randomly in the interval.

      • type: str

      • accepted: "grid" or "random"

      • default: grid

    • optimizer

      Dictionary containing information on the optimizer and its options.

      • type: dict with the following structure:

        • “name” (value type: str) This is always set to "scipy", which is by now the only available optimizer for this task. As more optimizers will be supported the "name" key will indicate the chosen one.

        • “method” (value type: str) Optimizer method. For the scipy.optimize.minimize optimizer the default method is given by "Powell".

        • “options” (value type: dict) Dictionary containing additional options to pass to the scipy.optimize.minimize function.

      • default: {}

      • schematic example:

        optimizer={"name": "scipy",
           "method": "Powell",
           "options": {"maxiter": 10000,
                       "ftol": 0.001}}

    • timestamp

      A timestamp string with format "datetime_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S_%fZ")[:-3]. If it is not passed, then it is generated. It is used as key in the Lik.predictions["logpdf_max"] dictionary to save the current prediction. It is also used to update the Lik.log dictionary and to save the object when overwrite="dump".

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • progressbar

      If True then a progress bar is shown.

      • type: bool

      • default: True

    • save

      If True the object is saved (by passing the overwrite argument to the Lik.save method).

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function. If "dump", a dump of the file is saved through the utils.generate_dump_file_name function.

      • type: bool or str

      • allowed str: "dump"

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates files

    • Lik.output_h5_file (only if save=True)

    • Lik.output_log_file (always)

Lik.update_figures(figure_file=None, timestamp=None, overwrite=False)[source]¶

Method that generates new file names and renames old figure files when new ones are produced with the argument overwrite=False. When overwrite=False it calls the utils.check_rename_file function and, if figure_file already existed in the Lik.predictions dictionary, then it updates the dictionary by appennding to the old figure name the timestamp corresponding to its generation timestamp (that is the key of the Lik.predictions["Figures"] dictionary). When overwrite="dump" it calls the utils.generate_dump_file_name function to generate the dump file name. It returns the new figure_file.

  • Arguments

    • figure_file

      Figure file path. If the figure already exists in the Lik.predictions dictionary, then its name is updated with the corresponding timestamp.

    • overwrite

      The method updates file names and Lik.predictions dictionary only if overwrite=False. If overwrite="dump" the method generates and returns the dump file path. If overwrite=True the method does nothing.

  • Creates/updates files

    • Updates figure_file file name.

Lik.plot_logpdf_par(pars=[[0, 0, 1]], npoints=100, pars_init=None, pars_labels='original', title_fontsize=12, show_plot=False, timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Plots the logpdf as a function of of the parameter par in the range (min,max) using a number npoints of points. Only the parameter par is veried, while all other parameters are kept fixed to their value given in pars_init. The function used for the plot is provided by the Lik.logpdf_fn.

  • Arguments

    • pars

      List of lists containing the position of the parametes in the parameters vector, and their minimum and maximum values for the plot. For example, to plot parameter 1 in the rage (1,3) and parameter 5 in the range (-3,3) one should set pars = [[1,1,3],[5,-3,3]].

      • type: list

      • shape: [[par,par_max,par_min],...]

      • default: [[0,0,1]]

    • npoints

      Number of points in which the (par_min,par_max) range is divided to compute the logpdf and make the plot.

      • type: int

      • default: 100

    • pars_init

      Central point in the parameter space from which par is varied and all other parameters are kept fixed. When its value is the default None, the attribute Lik.pars_central is used.

      • type: numpy.ndarray or None

      • shape: (n_pars,)

      • default: None

    • pars_labels

      Argument that is passed to the Lik.__set_pars_labels method to set the parameters labels to be used in the plot.

      • type: list or str

      • shape of list: [ ]

      • accepted strings: "original", "generic"

      • default: "original"

    • title_fontsize

      Font size of the figure title.

      • type: int

      • default: 12

    • show_plot

      If True the plot is shown on the interactive console.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • timestamp

      A timestamp string with format "datetime_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S_%fZ")[:-3]. If it is not passed, then it is generated. It is used as key in the Lik.predictions["logpdf_max"] dictionary to save the current prediction. It is also used to update the Lik.log dictionary and to save the object when overwrite="dump".

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function. If "dump", a dump of the file is saved through the utils.generate_dump_file_name function.

      • type: bool or str

      • allowed str: "dump"

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior. The plots are shown in the interactive console calling plt.show() only if verbose=True.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates files

    • Lik.output_figures_base_file + "_par_" + str(par[0]) + ".pdf" for each par in pars.

Lik.plot_tmu_1d(pars_labels='original', title_fontsize=12, show_plot=False, timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Plots the 1-dimensional \(t_{\mu}\) stored in Lik.predictions["logpdf_profiled_max"][timestamp]["tmu"].

  • Arguments

    • pars_labels

      Argument that is passed to the Lik.__set_pars_labels method to set the parameters labels to be used in the plot.

      • type: list or str

      • shape of list: [ ]

      • accepted strings: "original", "generic"

      • default: "original"

    • title_fontsize

      Font size of the figure title.

      • type: int

      • default: 12

    • show_plot

      If True the plot is shown on the interactive console.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • timestamp

      A timestamp string with format "datetime_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S_%fZ")[:-3]. If it is not passed, then it is generated. It is used as key in the Lik.predictions["logpdf_max"] dictionary to save the current prediction. It is also used to update the Lik.log dictionary and to save the object when overwrite="dump".

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function. If "dump", a dump of the file is saved through the utils.generate_dump_file_name function.

      • type: bool or str

      • allowed str: "dump"

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior. The plots are shown in the interactive console calling plt.show() only if verbose=True.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates files

    • Lik.output_figures_base_file + "_tmu_" + str(par) + ".pdf".

Lik.set_verbosity()¶

Method inherited from the Verbosity object. See the documentation of Verbosity.set_verbosity.
